name: Mentha piperita
Relationship: Compare: RUMEX; LACHES.; MENTHA PULEGIUM - European penny royal - (pain in bones of forehead and extremities). MENTHA VIRIDIS - Spearmint - (scanty urine with frequent desire).

Respiratory: Dry cough, worse from air into larynx, tobacco smoke, fog, talking; with irritation in suprasternal fossa  trachea painful to touch
Tip of nose sore to touch
Throat dry and sore, as if pin crosswise in it
Abdomen: Bilious colic with great accumulation of gas
Skin: Itching of arm and hand when writing

details: Stimulates the cold-perceiving nerves so just after taking it a current of air at the ordinary temperature seems cold. Marked action on respiratory organs and skin. Useful in gastrodynia, flatulent cold.
dosage: Tincture, 1 to 20 drops, to thirtieth potency. Locally, in pruritis vaginae.
